sense.name: Act in an arrogant manner, usually demonstrated by walking in a characteristic way.
sense.examples: He swaggered up to the bar and ordered a drink. He swaggers around like a rooster in a hen house. She swaggers like her boyfriend, if not more.

sense.name: Discourage or frighten with threats; intimidate.
sense.examples: She swaggered him into giving up the money. He well nigh swaggered her out of everything.
